.
Definition: Signatures on Rating Decisions
Rating decisions must contain the decision maker’s digital signature on the bottom of the last page of the
Codesheet
.
A rating decision
signature
is defined as
an electronic signature certification statement as shown in
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.B.7.b
, and
the user’s
local area network identification (LAN ID), and
job title.
Important
:
If a rating decision requires more than one signature, the rating decision
Codesheet
must display the required additional signature fields.
The signature of the decision maker(s) certifies that the claims folder was reviewed and all phases of the claims process leading to the decision were correctly handled.
References
:  For more information on
signature requirements for legacy appeal decisions, see
M21-5, Chapter 7, Section D.3.c
completing the signature field on the rating decision
Codesheet
, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.B.7.b
two-signature rating decisions, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.B.7.d
second signature procedures, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.B.7.e
, and
a sample rating decision
Codesheet
signature field, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iv, 1.B.7.f
.
